original: Puggalapaññatti
analyzed: puggala paññatti
translated: Description of Persons

original: Niddesa
analyzed: niddesa
translated: The Niddesa

original: 7. Sattakapuggalapaññatti
analyzed: sattaka puggala paññatti
translated: The Description of Seven Types of Persons

original: Kathañca puggalo sakiṁ nimuggo nimuggova hoti?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ sakim nimuggaḥ nimuggaḥ uva hoti
translated: And how is a person one who sinks down and keeps sinking down?

original: Idhekacco puggalo samannāgato hoti ekantakāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo samannāgataḥ hoti ekanta kāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi
translated: It is a person who is possessed of entirely dark, unwholesome states.

original: Evaṁ puggalo sakiṁ nimuggo nimuggova hoti.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ sakim nimuggaḥ nimuggaḥ uva hoti
translated: This is how a person is one who sinks down and keeps sinking down.

original: Kathañca puggalo ummujjitvā nimujjati?🔽Idhekacco puggalo ummujjati “sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu,
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ ummujjitvā nimujjati  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjati sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu
translated: And how is a person one who emerges and then sinks down?

original: sādhu ottappaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu vīriyaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu ottappam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu vīriyam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesu uti
translated: It is a person who emerges, saying: “Good is faith in wholesome states, good is conscience, good is shame, good is energy, good is wisdom in wholesome states.”🔽But his faith does not stand up to questioning,

original: Tassa sā saddhā neva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyeva, tassa sā hirī neva tiṭṭhati
analyzed: tassa sā saddhā na iva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyā iva tassa sā hirī na iva tiṭṭhati
translated: his conscience does not stand up to questioning,🔽his shame does not stand up to questioning,

original: no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyeva, tassa taṁ ottappaṁ neva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyeva,
analyzed: no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyā iva tassa tam ottappam na iva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyā iva
translated: his energy does not stand up to questioning,

original: tassa taṁ vīriyaṁ neva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyeva, tassa sā paññā neva tiṭṭhati
analyzed: tassa tam vīriyam na iva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyā iva tassa sā paññā na iva tiṭṭhati
translated: his wisdom does not stand up to questioning,

original: no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyeva.
analyzed: na u vaḍḍhati hāyatiyā iva
translated: but does not increase and only declines.

original: Evaṁ puggalo ummujjitvā nimujjati.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ ummujjitvā nimujjati
translated: This is how a person emerges and then submerges.

original: Kathañca puggalo ummujjitvā ṭhito hoti?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ ummujjitvā ṭhitaḥ hoti
translated: And how does a person emerge and then stand?

original: Idhekacco puggalo ummujjati “sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu,
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjati sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu
translated: There is the case where a person emerges, “Excellent is confidence in wholesome qualities! Excellent is conscience!

original: sādhu ottappaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu vīriyaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu ottappam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu vīriyam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesu uti
translated: Excellent is shame! Excellent is energy! Excellent is mindfulness! Excellent is concentration! Excellent is discernment!🔽His confidence does not decline,

original: Tassa sā saddhā neva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti, tassa sā hirī neva hāyati no
analyzed: tassa sā saddhā na iva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti tassa sā hirī na iva hāyati no
translated: His conscience does not decline,🔽His shame does not decline,

original: vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti, tassa taṁ ottappaṁ neva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitaṁ hoti, tassa
analyzed: vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti tassa tam ottappam na iva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitam hoti tassa
translated: His energy does not decline,🔽His mindfulness does not decline,🔽His concentration does not decline,

original: taṁ vīriyaṁ neva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitaṁ hoti, tassa sā paññā neva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti.
analyzed: tam vīriyam na iva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitam hoti tassa sā paññā na iva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti
translated: His discernment does not decline.

original: Evaṁ puggalo ummujjitvā ṭhito hoti.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ ummujjitvā ṭhitaḥ hoti
translated: This is how a person emerges and then stands.

original: Kathañca puggalo ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi?
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ ummujjitvā vipassati
translated: And how does a person emerge and then look around?

original: Idhekacco puggalo ummujjati “sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu,
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjati sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu
translated: “Here, someone emerges thus: ‘It is good to be confident in wholesome states, it is good to have conscience in wholesome states,

original: sādhu ottappaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu vīriyaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu ottappam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu vīriyam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesu uti
translated: “Here someone emerges thus: ‘Good is faith in wholesome states, good is conscience, good is shame, good is energy, good is wisdom in wholesome states.’

original: So tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano.
analyzed: so tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannaḥ hoti a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyano
translated: With the destruction of three fetters he is a stream-enterer, no longer subject to the lower world, fixed in destiny, heading for enlightenment.

original: Evaṁ puggalo ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ ummujjitvā vipassati
translated: This is how a person emerges and then penetrates.

original: Kathañca puggalo ummujjitvā patarati?🔽Idhekacco puggalo ummujjati “sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu,
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ ummujjitvā patarati  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjati sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu
translated: “And how does a person emerge and then cross over?

original: sādhu ottappaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu vīriyaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu ottappam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu vīriyam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesu uti
translated: “Here someone emerges thus: ‘Good is faith in wholesome states, good is conscience, good is shame, good is energy, good is wisdom in wholesome states.’

original: So tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṁ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti sakideva imaṁ lokaṁ āgantvā dukkhassantakaro hoti.
analyzed: so tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā rāga dosa mohānam tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti sakideva imam lokam āgantvā dukkhassanta karaḥ hoti
translated: With the destruction of three fetters and with the attenuation of passion, hatred, and delusion, he is a once-returner who, after coming back to this world only one more time, will make an end of suffering.

original: Evaṁ puggalo ummujjitvā patarati.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ ummujjitvā patarati
translated: This is how a person emerges and then keeps going.

original: Kathañca puggalo ummujjitvā patigādhappatto hoti?🔽Idhekacco puggalo ummujjati “sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu,
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ ummujjitvā pati gādha ppattaḥ hoti  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjati sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu
translated: And how does a person emerge and then land in a safe place?

original: sādhu ottappaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu vīriyaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu ottappam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu vīriyam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesu uti
translated: There is the case where a person emerges, “Good is confidence in the wholesome! Good is conscience! Good is shame! Good is energy! Good is mindfulness! Good is concentration! Good is wisdom!”

original: So pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
analyzed: so pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: With the ending of the five lower fetters, he is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.

original: Evaṁ puggalo ummujjitvā paṭigādhappatto hoti.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ ummujjitvā paṭigādha ppattaḥ hoti
translated: This is how a person emerges and then lands in a safe place.

original: Kathañca puggalo ummujjitvā tiṇṇo hoti pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo?🔽Idhekacco puggalo ummujjati “sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu,
analyzed: kathañca puggalaḥ ummujjitvā tiṇṇaḥ hoti pāraṅgataḥ thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇaḥ  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ummujjati sāhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu sādhu hirī kusalesu dhammesu
translated: And how does a person emerge and then stand on high ground?

original: sādhu ottappaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu vīriyaṁ kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu ottappam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu vīriyam kusalesu dhammesu sādhu paññā kusalesu dhammesu uti
translated: There is the case where a person emerges, “Good is confidence in the wholesome! Good is conscience! Good is shame! Good is energy! Good is mindfulness! Good is concentration! Good is wisdom!”

original: So āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: so āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: He, by the destruction of the taints, enters & remains in the taintless release of the heart, the release by wisdom, realizing it for himself with direct knowledge.

original: Evaṁ puggalo ummujjitvā tiṇṇo hoti pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo.
analyzed: evam puggalaḥ ummujjitvā tiṇṇaḥ hoti pāraṅgataḥ thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: This is the sort of person who, emerging from the water, stands on the bank.

original: Katamo ca puggalo ubhatobhāgavimutto?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ
translated: And what sort of person is one liberated in both ways?

original: Idhekacco puggalo aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya ca ssa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti
translated: There is the case where a person dwells with his awareness suffused with the eight liberations.1 His effluents are ended through the ending of craving.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo ubhatobhāgavimutto.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ
translated: This is called the sort of person who is one liberated in both ways.

original: Katamo ca puggalo paññāvimutto …pe….🔽Kāyasakkhī ….🔽Diṭṭhippatto ….
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo paññā vimutto pe  kāyasakkhī  diṭṭhi ppatto
translated: And what sort of person is one liberated by wisdom? …🔽one attained to view …

original: Saddhāvimutto ….
analyzed: saddhā vimuttaḥ
translated: one liberated by faith …

original: Dhammānusārī ….
analyzed: dhamma anusārī
translated: one a personal witness …

original: Katamo ca puggalo saddhānusārī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ saddhā anusārī
translated: And what sort of person is one liberated by faith?

original: Yassa puggalassa sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa saddhindriyaṁ adhimattaṁ hoti, saddhāvāhiṁ saddhāpubbaṅgamaṁ ariyamaggaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: yassa puggalassa sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa saddhi indriyam adhimattam hoti saddhā vāhim saddhā pubbaṅgamam ariya maggam bhāveti
translated: There is the case where a person is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream entry. His faculty of faith is strong, his faith-following is strong. He develops the noble eightfold path for their attainment.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo saddhānusārī.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ saddhā anusārī
translated: This is called the sort of person who is liberated by faith.

original: Sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno puggalo saddhānusārī, phale ṭhito saddhāvimuttoti.
analyzed: sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ puggalo saddhā anusārī phale ṭhito saddhā vimuttaḥ ti
translated: The person who is practising for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry is a faith devotee; when he is established in the fruit he is a faith-liberated one.

original: Sattakaniddeso.
analyzed: sattaka niddesaḥ
translated: The Description of the Septets is ended.
